alert.note: Alert for Clay (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:47PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Clay County through 215 PM EDT... At 147 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tanksley, or near Manchester. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bernice around 205 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Manchester, Littleton, Hector, Horse Creek Junction, Boho, Enline, Hima, Peabody, Sibert and Herron. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
